channel.title: Quests
channel.description: I'm still trying to figure out how these servers are supposed to work. For one thing, I don't care If I can get online with other people. I just want to be able to make my own items, models, and quests. It's gonna take a lot of learning, but I can do it =). Anyway, I'm using the moparscape client. How am I supposed to edit the models and put in new items? How can I put in quests? Is there any specific software I should download? Please help, thanks

item.title: Quests
item.dc:creator: @goldragon83 goldragon83
item.description:
@goldragon83 wrote:

I’m using the one that I downloaded onto my desktop…so I don’t think it’s the webclient

Read full topic

item.title: Quests
item.dc:creator: @goldragon83 goldragon83
item.description:
@goldragon83 wrote:

In the moparscape client I don’t see any models…where are they?

Read full topic

item.title: Quests
item.dc:creator: @kpop kpop
item.description:
@kpop wrote:

Goldragon83,
I suggest downloading a 317 source and client first, preferably two that come in a pack similar to this…
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,395965.0.html
Then explore the files a bit! Have fun and look at what’s in there. Custom items go into the client in the models folder and quests are added in the source. Look at guides and if you need help always remember there are Server Help, Client Help, Model Help, Compiler Help for you to ask questions. I hope anything I said at all was of any help whatsoever. Goodluck with coding and gaining experience and I hope to see more advancements from you.

Read full topic

jdk?

Java Development Kit.

item.title: Quests
item.dc:creator: @chippeh chippeh
item.description:
@chippeh wrote:

jdk…? lol
You have to be somewhat experienced to make quests. You need to master placing npc’s, making objects, items and npc’s do actions aswell. Experiment with these, than try reading some tuts, also download a source with quests already in it, and see what you can do to edit them

Read full topic
